endpoint.description: The API endpoint to use. Can be specified with the `MIGADU_ENDPOINT` environment variable. Defaults to `https://api.migadu.com/v1/`. Take a look at https://www.migadu.com/api/#api-requests for more information.

timeout.description: The timeout to apply for HTTP requests in seconds. Can be specified with the `MIGADU_TIMEOUT` environment variable. Defaults to `10`.

token.description: The API key to use. Can be specified with the `MIGADU_TOKEN` environment variable. Take a look at https://www.migadu.com/api/#api-keys for more information.

username.description: The username to use. Can be specified with the `MIGADU_USERNAME` environment variable. Take a look at https://www.migadu.com/api/#api-requests for more information.

block.description: Provider for the [Migadu](https://www.migadu.com/api/) API. Requires Terraform 1.0 or later.

address.description: The email address `local_part@domain_name` as returned by the Migadu API. This might be different from the `id` attribute in case you are using international domain names. The Migadu API always returns the punycode version of a domain.

destinations.description: Set of email addresses that act as destinations of the alias.

domain_name.description: The domain name of the alias.

expirable.description: Whether this alias expires at some time.

expires_on.description: The expiration date of this alias.

is_internal.description: Internal aliases can only receive emails from Migadu email servers.

local_part.description: The local part of the alias.

remove_upon_expiry.description: Whether to remove this alias upon expiry.

address.description: Contains the email address of the identity `identity@domain_name` as returned by the Migadu API. The Migadu API always returns the punycode version of a domain.

domain_name.description: The domain name of the mailbox/identity.

footer_active.description: Whether the footer of the identity is active.

footer_html_body.description: The footer of the identity in `text/html` format.

footer_plain_body.description: The footer of the identity in `text/plain` format.

identity.description: The local part of the identity.

local_part.description: The local part of the mailbox that owns the identity.

may_access_imap.description: Whether the identity is allowed to use IMAP.

may_access_manage_sieve.description: Whether the identity is allowed to manage the mail sieve.

may_access_pop3.description: Whether the identity is allowed to use POP3.

may_receive.description: Whether the identity is allowed to receive emails.

may_send.description: Whether the identity is allowed to send emails.

block.description: Provides an identity to an existing mailbox.

address.description: The email address of the mailbox `local_part@domain_name` as returned by the Migadu API. This might be different from the `id` attribute in case you are using international domain names. The Migadu API always returns the punycode version of a domain.

auto_respond_active.description: Whether an automatic response is active in this mailbox.

auto_respond_body.description: The body of the automatic response.

auto_respond_expires_on.description: The expiration date of the automatic response.

auto_respond_subject.description: The subject of the automatic response.

domain_name.description: The domain name of the mailbox.

expirable.description: Whether this mailbox expires in the future.

expires_on.description: The expiration date of this mailbox.

footer_active.description: Whether the footer of this mailbox is active.

footer_html_body.description: The footer of this mailbox in text/html format.

footer_plain_body.description: The footer of this mailbox in text/plain format.

is_internal.description: Whether this mailbox is internal only. An internal mailbox can only receive emails from Migadu servers.

local_part.description: The local part of the mailbox.

may_access_imap.description: Whether this mailbox is allowed to use IMAP.

may_access_manage_sieve.description: Whether this mailbox is allowed to manage the mail sieve.

may_access_pop3.description: Whether this mailbox is allowed to use POP3.

may_receive.description: Whether this mailbox is allowed to receive emails.

may_send.description: Whether this mailbox is allowed to send emails.

password_method.description: The password method of this mailbox. If this is set to 'invitation' an email will be send to the 'password_recovery_email' and users can set their own password.

password_recovery_email.description: The recovery email address of this mailbox.

recipient_denylist.description: The email addresses of recipients that will always be denied delivery.

remove_upon_expiry.description: Whether this mailbox will be removed upon expiry.

sender_allowlist.description: The email addresses of senders that will always be allowed delivery.

sender_denylist.description: The email addresses of senders that will always be denied delivery.

spam_action.description: The action to take once spam arrives in this mailbox.

spam_aggressiveness.description: How aggressive will spam be detected in this mailbox.

destinations.description: The destinations of the rewrite rule.

domain_name.description: The domain name of the rewrite rule.

local_part_rule.description: The regular expression matching the local part of incoming emails.

name.description: The name (slug) of the rewrite rule.

order_num.description: The order of the rewrite rule. Lowest will be executed first.

address.description: The email address of the alias `local_part@domain_name` as returned by the Migadu API. This might be different from the `id` attribute in case you are using international domain names. The Migadu API always returns the punycode version of a domain.

destinations.description: List of email addresses that act as destinations of the alias.

domain_name.description: The domain name of the alias.

expirable.description: Whether the alias expires at some time.

expires_on.description: The expiration date of the alias.

is_internal.description: Whether the alias is internal only. An internal alias can only receive emails from Migadu servers.

local_part.description: The local part of the alias.

remove_upon_expiry.description: Whether to remove the alias upon expiry.

block.description: Get information about an email alias.

address.description: The email address `local_part@domain_name` as returned by the Migadu API. The Migadu API always returns the punycode version of a domain.

destinations.description: List of email addresses that act as destinations of the alias.

domain_name.description: The domain name of the alias.

expirable.description: Whether the alias expires some time in the future.

expires_on.description: The expiration date of the alias.

is_internal.description: Whether the alias is internal and can only receive emails from Migadu servers.

local_part.description: The local part of the alias.

remove_upon_expiry.description: Whether the alias is removed once it is expired.

aliases.description: The configured aliases for the given `domain_name`.

domain_name.description: The domain name of all aliases.

block.description: Get information about all email aliases of a domain.

domain_name.description: The domain name of the mailbox/identities.

address.description: The email address of the identity `identity@domain_name` as returned by the Migadu API. The Migadu API always returns the punycode version of a domain.

footer_active.description: Whether the footer of the identity is active.

footer_html_body.description: The footer of the identity in `text/html` format.

footer_plain_body.description: The footer of the identity in `text/plain` format.

local_part.description: The local part of the identity.

may_access_imap.description: Whether the identity is allowed to use IMAP.

may_access_manage_sieve.description: Whether the identity is allowed to manage the mail sieve.

may_access_pop3.description: Whether the identity is allowed to use POP3.

may_receive.description: Whether the identity is allowed to receive emails.

may_send.description: Whether the identity is allowed to send emails.

identities.description: The configured identities for the given `domain_name` and `local_part`.

local_part.description: The local part of the mailbox that owns the identities.

block.description: Get information about all identities owned by mailbox.

address.description: The email address of the identity `identity@domain_name` as returned by the Migadu API. The Migadu API always returns the punycode version of a domain.

domain_name.description: The domain name of the mailbox/identity.

footer_active.description: Whether the footer of the identity is active.

footer_html_body.description: The footer of the identity in `text/html` format.

footer_plain_body.description: The footer of the identity in `text/plain` format.

identity.description: The local part of the identity.

may_access_imap.description: Whether the identity is allowed to use IMAP.

may_access_manage_sieve.description: Whether the identity is allowed to manage the mail sieve.

may_access_pop3.description: Whether the identity is allowed to use POP3.

may_receive.description: Whether the identity is allowed to receive emails.

may_send.description: Whether the identity is allowed to send emails.

auto_respond_body.description: The body of the automatic response.

auto_respond_expires_on.description: The expiration date of the automatic response.

auto_respond_subject.description: The subject of the automatic response.

is_internal.description: Whether the mailbox is internal only. An internal mailbox can only receive emails from Migadu servers.

may_access_imap.description: Whether the mailbox is allowed to use IMAP.

may_access_manage_sieve.description: Whether the mailbox is allowed to manage the mail sieve.

recipient_denylist.description: The email addresses of recipients that will always be denied delivery.
